intro: Heeria salicina, commonly known as the silverleaf heeria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. This plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments.
